highlights.description: Git backend abstraction with go-git and CLI implementations
Optional `--go-git` flag for pure Go git operations (no process spawning)

added.description: Git backend interface with `GitBackend`, `GoGitBackend`, and `CLIGitBackend` types
`--go-git` flag to use go-git library instead of git CLI
Go-git integration for pure Go git operations without external process spawning

changed.description: Git CLI is now the default backend (faster and more compatible)
Scanner package uses `GitBackend` interface for pluggable git implementations

performance.description: Git CLI backend: ~2.5s for 600 repos (default, faster)
Go-git backend: ~10s for 600 repos (optional, pure Go)

dependencies.description: Added `github.com/go-git/go-git/v5` for pure Go git operations

documentation.description: Updated README with `--go-git` flag and backend comparison table

highlights.description: New `order` subcommand for topological dependency ordering

added.description: New `order` subcommand to show repos in dependency order (update dependencies first)
Topological sort using Kahn's algorithm for dependency-aware ordering
Time-based filtering with `-since` flag supporting `7d`, `2w`, `1m` duration formats
Transitive dependency tracking with `-t` flag to include repos that depend on modified repos
Unpushed commit detection with `-u` flag to filter repos needing push
Internal dependency display showing `(depends on: x, y)` in output
Latest modification time tracking per repository
Parallel scanning using goroutine worker pool (uses GOMAXPROCS workers)
Lazy evaluation of expensive operations (mod time, unpushed checks)
Aligned output formatting with consistent column widths

changed.description: Migrated CLI from standard `flag` package to Cobra for better UX
Output now shows numbered list with alphabetical sorting
Refactored scanner package with `ScanOptions` for configurable behavior

performance.description: Optimized git status to single command per repo (was 2-3 commands)
Scan time reduced by ~50% (6.7s â†’ 3.4s for 600 repos)

documentation.description: Updated README with order subcommand, new flags, and performance section

highlights.description: CLI tool to scan multiple Git repositories and identify repos needing attention
Zero external dependencies - uses only Go standard library

added.description: Repository scanner that checks for uncommitted changes using `git status --porcelain`
Replace directive detection in go.mod files (both single-line and block format)
Module name mismatch detection comparing go.mod module path with directory name
Dependency filtering with `-dep` flag to find repos depending on a specific module
Recursive nested go.mod search with `-recurse` flag for monorepo support
Progress bar with percentage, count, and current repo name during scanning
Two output formats: human-readable list (default) and compact markdown table
Summary statistics showing counts of uncommitted changes, replace directives, and mismatches
Tilde expansion for home directory paths
Support for positional argument or `-dir` flag for directory path

documentation.description: README with installation, usage, flags reference, and examples
